intro: Peltostigma pteleoides, commonly known as the Indian nettle or Indian nettle plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has a creeping growth habit and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
